content.p: XCSoar is Pocket PC Software designed for Organisers. Although technically we can now compile for Windows desktop as well, our primary goal is to be on Pocket PC Organisers. Therefore you will probably need one - or have one.

Standard systems include:
Pocket PC - also called Windows CE 3.0 (pre 3.0 is not supported)
Pocket PC 2002
Pocket PC 2003 - also called Windows Mobile 2003 (1st and 2nd ediition)
Some processors supported (depending on your operating system):
SH3 = ?
MIPS (PPC and 2002 only)
ARM (including Strong ARM and Intel X-Scale)
x86 (but only experimentally on the desktop)
Othe requirements:
Screen resolution: 320x240 or 640x480
Colour depth: any - but recommmend 256
Orientation: Portrait and Landscape fully supported
Serial port or Bluetooth for GPS
Storage space: 2MB for program up to 100MB for Data (optional, depends on location)
Memory: Anything fromm 16MB on an Aero to 128MB - recommend a minimum of 64MB
Windows CE 3.0 only - you must have the upgrade card. Also suggest you turn off terrain, possibly topology and use long or no snail trails.
